Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in denying citizenship due to non-compliance with residency requirements
Application_Facts: Applicant was absent from Canada for work with UNICEF, accumulated only 137 days of physical presence in Canada within the required four-year period; maintained property and family ties in Canada
Court_Ruling: The Citizenship Judge did not err in law or fact
Defendant_Behavior: Extended absences from Canada for international employment
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged error by Citizenship Judge in assessing residency compliance
Legal_Standard: 1,095 days of residence in Canada within four years before application
Assessment_Factor: Centrality of mode of living in Canada, nature and duration of absences
Review_Standard: Correctness standard with deference to Citizenship Judge's expertise
Evidence_Used: Record of entry and exit dates, proof of property ownership, family connections, employment details with UNICEF
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section of Citizenship Act regarding residency requirement (1,095 days)
Application_Basis: Naturalization through fulfillment of residency obligation
Evidence_Assessed: Residency records, personal and economic ties to Canada
Relief_Sought: Overturning of citizenship denial and approval of application
Governing_Rule: Applicants must be physically present in Canada for at least 1,095 days unless they centralize their mode of living in Canada
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of de facto residency despite claimed ties
Harm_Assessment: Applicant remains ineligible for Canadian citizenship
Cause_Description: Extensive absences from Canada due to employment with UNICEF
Evidence_Handling: Residency data reviewed; personal ties considered but outweighed by absence record
Legal_Provision_Violated: Residency requirement under the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Issues: Lack of documentation showing return intentions or temporary nature of absences
Evidence_Assessment: Judge assessed all evidence and found no centralization of mode of living in Canada
Decision_Rationale: Absences were extensive and not temporary; applicant failed to meet legal residency threshold
Evidentiary_Issues: No sufficient evidence that absences were temporary or that mode of living was centralized in Canada
Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective assessment of physical presence and centrality of life in Canada
